page.title: 16MRS ELIZABETH HOLMES
page.content:
Account by Florence Holmes Age 9
MY MOTHER On Mondays my mother goes to St Vincents to teach for 2 hours in the afternoon. Sometimes she teaches in different schools as a supply teacher. She cooks our dinners at the weekend and on Sundays we have roast meat and potatoes and some vegetables. She looks after me when I am ill. She takes me to Brownies and dancing classes and takes me to school and comes and fetches me. Her name is Elizabeth Holmes. She hardly has time to rest. She also washes all our clothes. I am an only child. My father is an architect and travels to London daily. For leisure she belongs to the Women's Institute, she is a trained artist and is a needlewoman and a lacemaker.
